purpose.summary: This file is the DBDGEN source defining the IMS database PASFLDBD. It specifies GSAM and BSAM access methods with no password protection. A single dataset group DSG001 defines input dataset DD1=PASFILIP and output dataset DD2=PASFILOP with fixed record format (RECFM=F) and length 100.
purpose.business_context: IMS database definition supporting sequential and random access to PAS files for input processing and output generation

inputs.name: PASFILIP
inputs.description: Input dataset (DD1) for the PASFLDBD IMS database

outputs.name: PASFILOP
outputs.description: Output dataset (DD2) for the PASFLDBD IMS database

business_rules.description: Database supports GSAM for random access and BSAM for sequential access
No password protection is required for database access
Datasets use fixed record format (RECFM=F) with record length of 100 bytes

open_questions.question: What is the business purpose of the PAS files (PASFILIP/PASFILOP)?
open_questions.context: File names suggest PAS file processing, but no details in source
open_questions.suggestion: Review calling application programs or IMS documentation

open_questions.question: Are there any associated PSB or PCB definitions?
open_questions.context: DBD defines database but no application program control blocks referenced
